title: Israel drops massive bomb in Beirut strike, as Lebanon mulls cease-fire
description: Israel has stepped up strikes on the city’s southern suburbs in recent days, an area Israeli officials say hosts Hezbollah militants and infrastructure.
author: Abbie Cheeseman, Suzan Haidamous
excerpt: Israel has stepped up strikes on the city’s southern suburbs in recent days, an area Israeli officials say hosts Hezbollah militants and infrastructure.
text: BEIRUT — The Israeli military dropped a 2,000-pound bomb equipped with a U.S.-made guidance kit on an 11-story building in Beirut early Friday, striking near the heart of the Lebanese capital as officials there mulled the new draft of a U.S.-backed cease-fire proposal.The attack, which was witnessed by a Washington Post reporter, collapsed the building in the Tayouneh neighborhood, sending a fireball into the sky and a plume of smoke over Beirut’s largest park. It came as Israel has stepped up strikes on the city’s southern suburbs in recent days, an area Israeli officials say hosts Hezbollah militants and infrastructure.
html:
BEIRUT — The Israeli military dropped a 2,000-pound bomb equipped with a U.S.-made guidance kit on an 11-story building in Beirut early Friday, striking near the heart of the Lebanese capital as officials there mulled the new draft of a U.S.-backed cease-fire proposal.

The attack, which was witnessed by a Washington Post reporter, collapsed the building in the Tayouneh neighborhood, sending a fireball into the sky and a plume of smoke over Beirut’s largest park. It came as Israel has stepped up strikes on the city’s southern suburbs in recent days, an area Israeli officials say hosts Hezbollah militants and infrastructure.
